newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ's SFO yet to complete report into Maori TV.
newsitem.headline: NZ's SFO yet to complete report into Maori TV.

text.p: The Serious Fraud Office has yet to complete its investigation into the affairs of pilot Maori language broadcaster Aotearoa Television Network, a spokeswoman said on Friday.
"ATN is still under investigation and no time frame has been indicated (for the release of the report)," SFO spokeswoman Antoinette Miller said, quoting acting SFO director Judge Ron Jamieson.
Sources in parliament had speculated earlier in the week that the report would be completed by today.
It is expected to be referred to interested parties for comment before being released, including to New Zealand First MP Tukoroirangi Morgan who was a director and presenter at the network.
The registrar of companies is also investigating ATN.
New Zealand First leader Winston Peters has said Morgan's future in the NZ First caucus would be left open until the SFO reported.

Opposition MPs have called for Morgan to resign after it was revealed he had spent $4000 of ATN money before becoming an MP on expensive clothes. Morgan said he had authority to spend the money, but staff at the station have denied this.
The resignation calls were renewed earlier this month after Morgan admitted seeking payment for a television interview and then misleading Peters about his knowledge of it.
